str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From sun and paraginomai; to be present together, i.e. To convene; by implication, to appear in aid.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A sight, spectacle. From the same as theoreo; spectatorship, i.e. a spectacle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To beat, strike, wound, inflict punishment.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The breast, chest. From histemi; the bosom, i.e. Chest.
